snippet: A lawyer for Lynne F. Stewart, who was sentenced to 10 years in prison for aiding terrorism, argued that her statements outside of court should not have been used against her.
abstract: Lawyers for disbarred attorney Lynne F Stewart, sentenced to 10 years in prison for aiding terrorism after she helped imprisoned client Sheik Omar Abdel Rahman communicate with his followers, appear before United States Court of Appeals; argue that statements Stewart made in public after her trial that indicated a lack of remorse were used against her in sentencing decision, violating her free speech.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Lynne F. Stewart, who was sentenced to 10 years in prison for aiding terrorism, argued that her statements outside of court should not have been used against her.

headline.seo: Free Speech Is Cited in Appeal of Lynne Stewart’s 10-Year Sentence
headline.main: Free-Speech Argument in Appeal of Disbarred Lawyer’s Sentence
headline.print_headline: Free-Speech Argument In a Lawyer’s Appeal
